overview_metadata.overview_title: More Than Four Sides of the Story
overview_metadata.overview_subtitle: Volume and Surface Area of Prisms and Pyramids
overview_metadata.overview_description: In this lesson, students calculate the volumes and surface areas of prisms and pyramids with regular polygon bases. They develop a strategy and calculate the areas of regular polygons, extending their understanding to calculate the surface areas and volumes of composite solids. They solve real-world mathematical problems involving volume and surface area of two- and three-dimensional objects.

overview_item_data_items: I can develop and use strategies to determine the areas of regular polygons.
I can calculate the volume and surface area of prisms, pyramids, and composite solids with regular polygon bases.
I can solve real-world problems involving the volume and surface area of three-dimensional objects.
The formula for the volume of any prism is <math><mi>V</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>B</mi><mi>h</mi></math>, where <math><mi>B</mi></math> is the base area and <math><mi>h</mi></math> is the height.

The formula for the volume of any pyramid is <math><mi>V</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>3</mn></mfrac><mi>B</mi><mi>h</mi></math>, where <math><mi>B</mi></math> is the base area and <math><mi>h</mi></math> is the height.
The surface area of any geometric solid is the sum of the areas of the surface of the solid.
A regular polygon has sides that are all the same length and angles that are all the same measure.
You can decompose a regular <math><mi>n</mi></math>-gon into <math><mi>n</mi></math> triangles that have the same size and shape.

To calculate the area of the <math><mi>n</mi></math>-gon, determine the area of one of the <math><mi>n</mi></math> triangles that have the same size and shape that you decomposed the regular <math><mi>n</mi></math>-gon into and multiply by <math><mi>n</mi></math>.

overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_title: Odd One Out: Other Prisms and Pyramids
overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_descriptio: Students consider the nets of four geometric solids.

overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_title: Measures of All Right Prisms and Right Pyramids
overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_descriptio: Students generalize strategies to calculate volumes and surface areas of right prisms and pyramids.
Students develop a strategy for calculating the areas of regular polygons.

overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_title: Area and Volume with Regular Polygons
overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_descriptio: Students solve problems with regular polygons, polygon composition, and volumes of solids.
Students generalize strategies to calculate volumes of any right prism or right pyramid.
